entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:29PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Along the Yukon River Into the Weekend... Water levels on the Yukon River will continue to rise and reach bankfull and likely go overbank in low lying areas over the next few days. A large ice jam upriver from Ruby released on Sunday and this surge of water is currently moving down the Yukon River. Some low lying fish camps or remote cabins along the river could be

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On Most Rivers This Week... Heavy snowmelt in the Brooks Range is causing water levels to rise on many rivers draining the south side of the Brooks Range. entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Continues Along the Yukon River And Lower Nowitna Rivers... The ice jam near the Kokrines Bible Camp broke early Sunday morning and water levels dropped along the Yukon River and Lower Nowitna River. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels On Most Rivers This Week... Warm temperatures across the Southeast Interior are causing significant high elevation snowmelt. Ice is now gone from most rivers across the Southeast Interior, but many rivers and streams will run high from the snowmelt and cover sloughs and gravel bars with water.
